title: Decision on bus fare revision within two days: NTC
byline: A decision regarding the revision of bus fares, in line with yesterday’s fuel price adjustment, will be made within the next two days, the National Transport Commission (NTC) has announced.

title: LIOC and Sinopec also increase fuel prices
byline: Lanka IOC and Sinopec Energy Lanka have also increased fuel prices following the announcement by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) pertaining to the fuel price revision, effective today (01).

title: Youth killed in shooting in Kahawatta
byline: A youth has been killed while another individual has sustained injuries in a shooting incident reported in Yainna, Kahawatta, last night (30), police stated.

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island
byline: A few showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts.

title: President emphasises need to rebuild a disciplined and virtuous society
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized the urgent need to rebuild a disciplined and virtuous society by restoring the spirit of humanity in a social environment where power and wealth have undermined positive values and fostered detrimental ones.

title: No price revision in July: Laugfs Gas
byline: Laugfs Gas PLC has announced that the company will not revise domestic LP gas prices for the month of July 2025.

title: Seat belts mandatory for passengers of all vehicles on expressways from September
byline: The Ministry of Transport says wearing seat belts will be mandatory to all passengers of light vehicles travelling on expressways from August 1, 2025.

title: Moratorium on Parate Law execution ends
byline: The government intends to hold discussions with relevant parties to resolve the issues surrounding the reimplementation of the Parate law, Deputy Minister of Economic Development Dr. Anil Jayantha Fernando has stated.

title: Royal train in Britain to be retired as King Charles seeks to modernise monarchy
byline: The Royal Train is being scrapped leaving the Royal Family in Britain without a dedicated set of railway carriages for the first time since the mid-nineteenth century.

title: Special interest scheme for FDs of senior citizens from today
byline: The Special Interest Scheme for Senior Citizens, which grants 3% higher interest for 12-month fixed deposits will be in effect from today (01), the Ministry of Finance has announced.

title: 935 people killed in Israeli strikes on Iran, official says
byline: Some 935 people were killed in Iran during the 12-day air war with Israel, based on the latest forensic data, a spokesperson for the Iranian judiciary said on Monday, according to state media.

title: Three including 3-year-old killed in separate road accidents
byline: Three people, including a three-year-old child, have died in separate road accidents reported across various parts of the country, police stated.

title: Elon Musk to launch ‘America Party’ if lawmakers pass Trump’s ‘Big, Beautiful bill’
byline: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk renewed his criticism of US President Donald Trump’s coveted tax-cut and spending bill, which he calls “Big, Beautiful bill” and threatened to unseat the lawmakers who support the bill after campaigning on limiting government spending,

title: Trump to host Netanyahu at the White House on Jul 7: US official
byline: United States President Donald Trump plans to host Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at the White House on Jul 7, a US official said, as the US president pressed for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas in Gaza, and the return of remaining hostages.

title: Discussions held to expand trade ties between Sri Lanka and India
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has held discussions with Indian business leaders to expand trade and investment opportunities across key sectors such as technology, manufacturing, education, innovation, entrepreneurship, agriculture, energy, and tourism.

title: Navy arrests seven Indian fishermen for poaching in Northern seas
byline: A total of seven fishermen from Rameswaram, India have been arrested by Sri Lankan Navy for poaching in seas off Talaimannar.

title: Thai court suspends Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra over a leaked phone call
byline: Thailand’s Constitutional Court suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra from office pending an investigation over a leaked phone call with a former Cambodian leader.

title: Three-wheeler unions bemoan decision to hike price of petrol 92 Octane
byline: Three-wheeler operators say they expected a considerable reduction in prices of fuel as promised by the National People’s Power (NPP) during the election stage.

title: Ex-SriLankan Airlines Chief Nishantha Wickramasinghe further remanded
byline: Former Chairman of SriLankan Airlines, Nishantha Wickramasinghe, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), has been further remanded until July 15, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: CAA to launch special raids to net errant rice traders
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) says that since a maximum retail price has been imposed on rice, raids will be conducted to penalize traders who sell rice at higher prices.

title: Maureen Hingert, first Sri Lankan to reach Miss Universe finals and enter Hollywood, passes away
byline: Maureen Neliya Ballard (née Hingert), professionally known as Jana Davi, has passed away.

title: Iranian cyberattacks remain a threat despite ceasefire, US officials warn
byline: A ceasefire between Iran and Israel has not ended the threat of cyberattacks from hacking groups supportive of Tehran, the FBI and federal cybersecurity officials warned Monday.

title: Litro Gas prices to remain unchanged in July
byline: The Chairman of the Litro Gas Company, Channa Gunawardena says that the prices of its domestic LP Gas cylinders will remain unchanged for the month of July 2025.

title: Ex-SriLankan Airlines chief Nishantha Wickramasinghe produced before court
byline: Former Chairman of SriLankan Airlines, Nishantha Wickramasinghe, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) and is currently in remand custody, has been produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court by prison officials.

title: Immigration Controller General pleads guilty to contempt of court charge
byline: The Controller General of Immigration and Emigration, Harsha Illukpitiya, who is accused of being in contempt of court after failing to enforce a court order related to the e-visa issuance process, has pleaded guilty before the Supreme Court.

title: Ex-DMT Commissioner General Nishantha Weerasingha arrested
byline: Former Commissioner General of Motor Traffic Nishantha Weerasingha has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Death toll in India’s Telangana chemical factory explosion rises to 36, may increase further
byline: At least 36 people have been killed and over 30 others injured in a massive explosion inside a chemical factory in the southern Indian state of Telangana, officials said Tuesday.

title: Over 22,000 premises inspected on day 2 of Mosquito Control Week
byline: The Ministry of Health states that a total of 22,294 premises were inspected today (July 1) as part of a special inspection campaign conducted under the National Mosquito Control Week, which commenced on June 30.

title: Amendments to registration procedure for self-directed overseas employment effective from today
byline: The requirement to certify the employment contracts of Sri Lankans seeking employment abroad in the industrial and corporate sectors through self-directed means has been implemented from today (July 01) by the Sri Lankan Missions in the relevant countries.

title: Ex-DMT Commissioner General and two others remanded
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the remand of three suspects, including former Commissioner General of the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT), Nishantha Anuruddha Weerasingha, until July 8.

title: Bus fares reduced by 0.55%
byline: The Minister of Transport has approved the reduction of bus fares by 0.55% effective from July 04, 2025 (Friday), according to the National Transport Commission (NTC).

title: Cabinet approves nationwide online traffic fine payment system
byline: Cabinet approval has been granted to implement the nationwide online traffic fine payment system, based on a pilot project introduced by the government, said Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation, Bimal Rathnayake.

title: SLBFE announces scholarships for children of Sri Lankan migrant workers
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has invited applications for scholarships for the school-aged children of Sri Lankan migrant workers who are registered with the SLBFE and have been employed or are permanently employed abroad.

title: Japan grants USD 2.5 mln to strengthen anti-corruption mechanisms in Sri Lanka
byline: In a significant step towards strengthening good governance and transparency in Sri Lanka, the Government of Japan has extended a grant of USD 2.5 million to support a new anti-corruption initiative implemented by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).

title: IMF Executive Board approves Sri Lanka’s fourth review
byline: The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has approved the Fourth Review of Sri Lanka’s Extended Fund Facility (EFF) arrangement.

title: China shares new development opportunities with South Asian nations: Sri Lankan Minister
byline: China is sharing new development opportunities with South Asian countries and is committed to achieving win-win outcomes, said Wasantha Samarasinghe, Sri Lankan minister of trade, commerce, food security and cooperative development.

title: Indian entrepreneurs explore investment opportunities in Sri Lanka
byline: A delegation of around 20 Indian entrepreneurs, comprising heads of several prominent Indian companies, stated that they are currently directing their attention towards new investment prospects in Sri Lanka..

title: Body of remaining missing fisherman found after boat capsizes off Tangalle
byline: The body of the second fisherman who went missing after a multi-day fishing vessel capsized off the coast of Paravi Wella in Tangalle has been recovered.
